name: Ape About Comedy Westerns Quiz | Movie Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who played the gunfighter who shot himself in the foot in "Support Your Local Gunfighter"?
questions.explanation:
Chuck Connors.

	Taylor Barton and Colonel Ames were racing to see who could get to the mother lode of gold. Every so often an explosion shook the town as their men searched for gold. A man pretending to be gunslinger Swifty Morgan took money from both sides to drive the other one out of town. The real Swifty Morgan (Chuck Connors) challenged conman Latigo Smith (James Garner) to a showdown. Just as Swifty pulled out his gun to shoot, another explosion shook the town, causing Swifty to shoot himself in the foot.

questions.text: Who played a "soft hearted" bank robber who helped a rabbi in "The Frisco Kid" (1979)?
questions.explanation:
Harrison Ford.

	1979 was a busy year for Harrison Ford. "Star Wars" was re-released. He starred in the World War II movie "Force 10 From Navarone". He also appeared in the comedy Western "The Frisco Kid". Gene Wilder played a rabbi with a fluffy beard and a Torah scroll who had adventures on the way to San Francisco with Tommy Lillard (Harrison Ford), a soft-hearted bank robber who decided to help the innocent rabbi. They were chased by a posse along the way and fought off criminals and native Americans.

questions.text: In which movie did Nervous Elk (Paul Lynde) try to help Cactus Jack (Kirk Douglas)?
questions.explanation:
The Villain.

	Cactus Jack kept failing when he tried to rob Charming Jones, so he asked Nervous Elk, the chief of a native American tribe, to use his warriors to attack, but they fell off their horses. Paul Lynde was famous for his wisecracks on "Hollywood Squares".

questions.text: In which movie did Jack Strawhorn (Bruce Dern) bribe the posse to join his gang instead of taking him in?
questions.explanation:
Posse.

	In "Posse" (1975) Kirk Douglas played the leader of a posse who captured famous criminal Jack Strawhorn (Bruce Dern), hoping the publicity would get him elected to public office. However, Jack kept bragging to the members of the posse that they could make a lot more money working for him than working for the man who was about to leave them behind anyway if he got elected.

questions.text: In which movie did Hedley (Harvey Korman) shoot a man for chewing gum?
options: Remind Me To Kill You Later
questions.explanation:
Blazing Saddles.

	In "Blazing Saddles" people were in line to sign up to join the hired bunch of goons Hedley wanted to use to attack Rock Ridge so he could sell the land to the railroad. Hedley asked one man what was in his mouth. The man replied, "Nothim." When Hedley discovered that the man was chewing gum, Hedley asked if he brought enough gum for everyone. The man replied, "I didn't know there would be so many." Hedley shot him. The Waco Kid replied, "He sure is strict."

questions.text: In the comedy musical Western "Go West" (1940) who said, "This is 1870. Don Ameche hasn't invented the telephone yet."?
questions.explanation:
Groucho Marx.

	The Marx Brothers did this western movie, in which they helped a young man try to settle an old family feud. He also tried to marry his girl friend. The Marx Brothers did their regular type of humor, including Chico playing the piano. In one scene someone suggested calling for help, but Groucho made a reference to the movie in which Don Ameche played Alexander Graham Bell, who invented the telephone.

questions.text: In which movie did Amos and Theo (Tim Conway and Don Knotts) promise to return to town so they could be hung for trying to rob the bank?
options: The Apple Dumpling Gang Rides Again
The Apple Dumpling Gang Gets Cooked
questions.explanation:
The Apple Dumpling Gang.

	Amos and Theo (Tim Conway and Don Knotts) were trapped while trying to steal from the bank at night. A fast trial was held where they were sentenced to hang later that week. After they left, someone said that if they were stupid enough to show up for the hanging, they deserved to hang. The main plot involved children who might inherit gold.

questions.text: In the Disney Western comedy "Hot Lead and Cold Feet", who played three characters?
questions.explanation:
Jim Dale.

	Jim Dale played a father and his two grown sons (Jasper, Wild Bill, and Eli).  The two sons were told that their father was dead and that they had to compete in an endurance race to see which brother would inherit the town. The evil Mayor Ragsdale (Darren McGavin) kept setting traps, hoping to kill the brothers so he could inherit the town.

questions.text: James Stewart played Tom Destry in which of these movies?
questions.explanation:
Destry Rides Again.

	In 1939 a movie called "Destry Rides Again" was released, in which James Stewart played a lawman who usually didn't carry a gun, although he was an expert shot. The saloon owner and criminal boss, Kent, of the Western town, Bottleneck, had the sheriff killed for asking too many questions. The mayor appointed the town drunk to be the new sheriff, thinking he wouldn't interfere with Kent's crimes, but the sheriff made Tom Destry, Jr. his deputy, who enforced the law.

questions.text: In the comedy Western "Wild Wild West" starring Will Smith, who played U.S. President U.S. Grant?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Kline.

	In the big screen movie "Wild Wild West" (1999) James West (Will Smith) and Artemus Gordon (Kevin Kline) fought the evil plans of Dr. Loveless (Kenneth Branagh) who traveled the United States in a giant mechanical spider, although the story was set in the 1800s. Kevin Kline also played U.S. President U.S. Grant. (If you ever see a picture of the real Grant, he happened to look like Kevin Kline with a beard.)
